result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Franklin J Lehman

defendant.name: Lehman, Franklin J
defendant.address: N6795 Cth A Lot #12, Lake Mills, WI 53551

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:50 AM 
Defendant Franklin J Lehman in court.  Attorney John Paul Holevoet in court for Franklin J Lehman.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

recess: 8:52am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/26/22 at 1:00pm   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 11/11/22 at 8:30am
Adjourned initial appearance on September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer - Att John Holevoet
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:31 PM 
Defendant Franklin J Lehman appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to Counsel reviewed, Mr. Lehman indicates that he intends to obtain private counsel
The Court tolls time limits

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.** 
recess 2:34  pm. 

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 8/31/22 at 1:15pm
